oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grace Episcopal Church: north elevation view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of white board and batten church viewed from the north. The small gabled section to the left is the narthex, or entryway. Three stained glass windows are visible. A low rock wall serves as a border between the property and the street.

Grace Episcopal Church was established in 1877 with the completion of the church building. It was constructed by P.J. Williamson in the Carpenter Gothic style along Main Street in Spring Hill at a cost of $1800.00 that was funded by members of the church and friends from the community.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Church buildings
Carpenter Gothic
Episcopal churches; Stone walls
